message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this exceptional product with you. I believe it's a game-changer and I'm confident you'll see its value. I'm willing to make a strong opening offer of $1,100,000.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I agree this product has great potential. However, I'm working with a tighter budget. Would you consider $900,000?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand you're working with a tighter budget, but I'm confident the product's value is worth more. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm counteroffering at $1,050,000.
I appreciate you meeting me halfway, Alice.  To be frank, $950,000 is as high as I can go. I believe that's a fair offer reflecting the value and my budget.

I understand you've reached your budget limit, Bob, but I still believe the product's value is higher. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to the minimum value I'm willing to accept. I'm counteroffering at $1,075,000.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  However, the gap between our valuations seems too large to bridge. I'm willing to make one final offer of $975,000. If this doesn't work, I'll unfortunately have to explore other options.

Bob, I understand you're trying to make a final offer, but I'm not willing to give up on the value of this product. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum acceptable price. I'm counteroffering at $1,050,000, which is the same price I offered in round 3. This is my final concession, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
